algorithm_technique: Prefix sums combined with a sliding window approach to find maximum sums of two non-overlapping subarrays.
Iterate through all possible split points for the two subarrays.
problem_summary_simple: Find the maximum sum of two non-overlapping subarrays of given lengths.
problem_summary_technical: Precompute prefix sums, then iterate through possible positions of one subarray and find the max sum of the other non-overlapping subarray.
key_insights: Prefix sums allow for O(1) calculation of subarray sums.
The problem can be broken down into two cases: the first subarray appears before the second, or vice-versa.
For each possible position of one subarray, we need to efficiently find the maximum sum of a non-overlapping subarray of the other length.
